sentences: Anthony Cruz (born March 9, 1972), better known by his stage name AZ, is an American rapper from Brooklyn, New York.
section: N/A

sentences: He is known for being a longtime and frequent music partner of East Coast rapper Nas and also a member of hip hop group The Firm alongside Nas, Foxy Brown, Cormega and Nature.
section: N/A

sentences: Online magazine About.com listed AZ as the "Most Underrated [Rapper] of All Time", and made it onto the sites' "Top 50 MCs of Our Time (1987–2007)", where he was reiterated as "arguably the most underrated lyricist ever."
section: N/A

sentences: AZ first became known by appearing on Nas's landmark 1994 album Illmatic on the song "Life's a Bitch", as well as featuring vocals on the opening track "The Genesis".
section: N/A

sentences: AZ signed with EMI, and soon released his debut album, Doe or Die, in 1995, to critical acclaim.
section: N/A

sentences: The album's lead single, "Sugar Hill", became AZ's major commercial success as a solo artist, reaching #25 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and achieving Gold status.
section: N/A

sentences: AZ's EMI contract was transferred to sister label Noo Trybe Records and Virgin Records when the EMI Label Group was shut down.
section: N/A

sentences: In 1997, AZ joined the group The Firm with Nas, Nature and Foxy Brown and released their only album as a group, The Album.
section: N/A

sentences: In 1998, AZ released his second solo album, Pieces of a Man.
section: N/A

sentences: The album fared well but did not chart quite as well as his debut and did not feature a crossover single like "Sugar Hill".
section: N/A

sentences: After this album's release, AZ signed with Motown and Universal Records and released 9 Lives.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2002 he released Aziatic.
section: N/A

sentences: A single from the album, "The Essence" (featuring Nas), was nominated at the 2003 Grammy Awards for Best Rap Performance by a Duo or Group.
section: N/A
== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: AZ was born in Bedford–Stuyvesant, Brooklyn to an African-American mother and Dominican father.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He grew up in East New York, Brooklyn with his mother and sister.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: AZ started writing rap lyrics when he was 12 years old.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In the early 1990s he became friends with Nas, a young rapper from Queens.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Nas started working with his debut album Illmatic and invited Cruz to work with him in a studio.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: AZ appeared on the album intro and had a verse on "Life's a Bitch".
section: == Early life ==

sentences: After Illmatic was released in 1994 EMI Records offered Cruz a record deal.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: Doe or Die was released on October 10, 1995, by EMI Records.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: The album features guest appearances by Nas and production from N.O. Joe, Pete Rock, L.E.S., and Buckwild, among others.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: Upon its release, Doe or Die received notable commercial success.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: The album peaked at #15 on the Billboard 200, and #1 on the U.S. Top R&B/Hip Hop Albums chart.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: Doe or Die was known for popularizing the theme of mafioso rap, alongside several albums, namely Jay-Z's Reasonable Doubt and Nas's It Was Written.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: Doe or Die produced several singles, including "Mo Money, Mo Murder, Mo Homicide", "Gimme Your's (remix)", "Doe or Die" and "Sugar Hill" - which was certified Gold by the RIAA in 1995.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: Pieces Of A Man, AZ's second album was released on EMI.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: 9 Lives, his third album, peaked at #23 on the Billboard 200 and #4 on the Top Hip Hop / R&B Albums.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: The leading single, "Problems", with its accompanying music video, reached #34 on the Hot Rap Singles.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: After the release of the album, AZ left the label.
section: == Career == | === 1995–2001: Doe or Die, Pieces of a Man and 9 Lives ===

sentences: 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format =
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===
== Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: Aziatic features a duet between AZ and long-time friend and collaborator, Nas, "The Essence", which was nominated for a Grammy for Best Rap Performance by a Duo.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: The album was mostly well received by critics, one such positive review from Brad Mills at Allmusic, states:
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: "AZ has been looked upon to do amazing things with his music.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: Has he lived up to those high expectations on this album he has from start to finish.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: The beats on this album are complex, inventive, and almost perfectly suited for AZ's style of rhyming.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: He's carefully crafted this album rather than slapped it together overnight to meet his quota, and it shows.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: It helps immensely that he's brought along people like DR Period, Az Izz, Nas, and Buckwild, but they don't outshine the younger AZ as he holds his own well.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: AZ has come up with his best work in a long time on this album.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: "A.W.O.L. was released on September 6, 2005.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: A.W.O.L. is the first AZ album which was released on his own Quiet Money Records imprint.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: The Format album features production from Lil' Fame of M.O.P., Face Defeat, Emile, J. Cardim, Phonte, Statik Selektah and DJ Premier.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: The album's lead single is its title track "The Format" produced by DJ Premier, with "Vendetta" as its B-Side.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: The Format also features the bonus track "Royal Salute" a retaliation to 50 Cent's song "What If" which included a line aimed at AZ.
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: On October 7, 2007, Quiet Money released The Format (Special Edition) adding six bonus tracks including "Royal Salute."
section: == Career == | === 2002–07: Aziatic, A.W.O.L. and The Format ===

sentences: === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===
== Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: Undeniable was released on April 1, 2008 through Quiet Money and Koch Records.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: The album debuted at number 141 on the U.S. Billboard 200 chart, selling over 25,000 copies in its first week.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: In October 2009, AZ confirmed he was working on his ninth studio album, titled Doe or Die 2.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: He hoped to enlist the original production team from Doe or Die such as L.E.S., Pete Rock, DR Period, and Buckwild.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: AZ also had ambitions on trying to acquire beats from DJ Toomp, Dr. Dre and Kanye West for the album, as well as reaching out to his old rhyme partner Nas.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: The first single from the album "Feel My Pain" was produced by Frank Dukes.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: In 2010 former member of Da Beatminerz Baby Paul confirmed he would be producing for the album and serving as executive producer.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: On November 30, 2010, he released a 15th anniversary edition of Doe or Die titled Doe or Die: 15th Anniversary.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: In 2010 Dr. Dre and Kanye West were said to be too busy to produce for the album, but AZ said he was patiently waiting for them to complete their next solo records so they can join the production team.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: He was also seeking production from DJ Premier.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: During a 2011 interview with XXLMag, AZ confirmed that Nas would be featured on the album.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: On March 27, 2012, AZ released the first street single from Doe or Die 2, "My Niggas", which features production from longtime collaborator Buckwild.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: The album's production includes tracks from Statik Selektah, Baby Paul and the original Doe or Die team of beatsmiths L.E.S., DR Period, Pete Rock, and Buckwild.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: AZ was heavily featured on Ghostface Killah's 2014 album 36 Seasons.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===

sentences: After several delays, Doe or Die II was released on September 10, 2021.
section: == Career == | === 2008–present: Undeniable, Legendary and Doe or Die 2 ===
